alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 09 at 9:26AM MDT until April 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM UNTIL 9 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK, EXCEPT FROM 11 AM UNTIL 9 PM MDT FROM THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD, DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM UNTIL 8 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOW PACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west and southwest winds will combine with several hours of single digit minimum humidities, well above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions this afternoon. Ridgetop winds will strengthen tonight and combine with poor humidity recoveries to produce locally critical fire weather conditions through the overnight hours. Consequently, critical conditions are expected to develop rapidly Sunday morning in many areas. Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions are forecast to persist areawide through Monday, then through Tuesday east of the central mountain chain. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, and Middle Rio Grande Valley this afternoon until mid evening, with locally critical conditions persisting into the late night hours. Critical conditions rapidly become widespread Sunday morning and persist through early evening, then return again Monday afternoon until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph this afternoon, then persisting over ridgetops and the continental divide tonight. Southwest to west 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Sunday. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Over 9 hours of single digit humidities today, then widespread poor humidity recovery tonight. Around 7 to 14 percent Sunday and Monday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
